byline.contributor: Frances Robles and Tatiana Schlossberg contributed reporting.
byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Justice Dept official says agency will file corruption charges against Sen Robert Menendez, culmination of two-year investigation into bribery allegations; case revolves around friendship between Menendez and wealthy surgeon Salomon Melgen, and will likely involve consideration of whether senator's activities are protected by Constitution from prosecution.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department expects to charge Senator Robert Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat, in an inquiry that has focused on his ties to a Florida eye doctor, an official said.

headline.main: Menendez Is to Face Corruption Charges, U.S. Official Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Set to Charge Menendez in Case Alleging Favors

snippet: The Justice Department expects to charge Senator Robert Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat, in an inquiry that has focused on his ties to a Florida eye doctor, an official said.
